title: What ideas do you have to strengthen the middle of the economic pyramid? - Quora

response.answer_text: Create  more jobs. The bloody rich fools want to have at a minimum of 200 job applicants for every 1 job opening. This puts more people on Disability, because those with developmental delay disorder and other Learning disabilities that make them best suited for stocking, Janitorial and other such jobs, can't get those jobs because those people who could do jobs that take more skills can't get them because those jobs are too few in number.  The more people in the middle class sector we have working, the more tax money that will be generated. We might even be able to persuade those in jobs that people on disability could do, to take skilled labour jobs so that we can get more people off of disability.  There are many skilled labour jobs that can't be filled where I live. In my opinion (and I might be wrong here) - perhaps they aren't willing to train people so that they can learn these jobs? What I mean is, if people aren't willing to go to tech school to learn, then maybe they need to have on the job training?

Not my idea, but getting rid of the pay-for-delay deal that brand name and generic drug manufacturers have (wherein a brand name company pays a generic drug company millions of dollars to NOT produce a generic that would save consumers 80-90%) would help the middle class lower health costs. Here is a link: Pay-for-delay drives up costs
